intro: Elaeosticta ferganensis, commonly known as the Fergana elaeosticta, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in temperate climates. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
